information.name: Jónas Grétar Jónasson
information.about: With over five years of experience developing hardware and software in the cycling industry, I can deliver end-to-end solutions for a wide range of problems.

entries.title: R&D systems engineer
entries.subtitle: Swiss Side Technologies AG, Thalwil, Switzerland.
entries.body: Developed, deployed and maintained a performance simulation platform for a world tour cycling team. Was a part of a two person team which developed a data acquisition system for wind tunnels, leveraging on-site and cloud infrastructure with an online report generation platform. Developed algorithms for performance simulation and data post-processing. Designed wind tunnel and on-road measurement equipment for the cycling industry.

entries.title: Support Engineer & Intern
entries.subtitle: Swiss Side Technologies AG, Thalwil, Switzerland.
entries.body: Assisted with processing of wind tunnel and CFD data for bicycle design projects.

entries.title: Intern, Energy Production department
entries.subtitle: Verkís Consulting Engineers, Reykjavík, Iceland
entries.body: Drew metal structures for hydropower plants. Implemented 3D CAD workflows for technical drawings. Reviewed subcontractor calculations for machinery.

entries.title: Mechanical Engineering MSc
entries.subtitle: ETH Zürich, Switzerland
entries.body:
Laboratory of Composite Materials and Adaptive Structures
Specializing in algorithms for structural optimization. Master thesis was a design study where a novel computational framework for optimization and simulation of patched laminates was developed. This was later adapted and published.

Overall average grade: 5.52 / 6

entries.title: Mechanical Engineering BSc
entries.subtitle: University of Iceland, Reykjavík
entries.body: Degree finished in two and a half years. First grade with distinction. Member of the formula student team, Team Spark, for two years.
This is still a work in progress!
